title: Drawing, 1730s
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on white wove paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Two stories, the lower with five the upper with three divisions. Stairs lead to the lateral left door and parallel to the façade to a ramp in front of the central part. at right are oblique stairs leading simultaneously to the lateral door and the ramp. The three doorcases are topped by coat of arms, at left and in the center identified as that of the Albani. Tablets are above the door frames at left and in the center, respectively, with the inscriptions: ALEXANDER ALBANVS; ANNIBAL ALBANVS; posts are at the foot of the ramp.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, 1730s. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-498.
